SENT.plain: Aplastic anemia is a very unusual feature of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)
A 32-year-old lady presented with generalized purpuric lesions and was diagnosed as having immune thrombocytopenic purpura
Fourteen months later, she developed progressive pancytopenia, arthritis of small joints, and oral ulcers
Investigations confirmed SLE with aplastic anemia
High-dose methylprednisolone therapy had been unsuccessful in controlling the pancytopenia
She had a progressive course and died due to septicemia
Even though pancytopenia is common in SLE, a bone marrow examination should be done in all cases of persistent pancytopenia to exclude bone marrow aplasia
This will help in tailoring the treatment with more aggressive immunosuppressants
